function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Neglecting the physical processes crucial to droplet evolution within an indoor environment.","Impact":"Increased risk of underestimating airborne transmission of contagious diseases.","Mitigation":"Incorporate the physical processes of droplet evolution into classification and transmission models.","Technologies":"Advanced imaging and modeling techniques for droplet dynamics in indoor environments.","People":"Public health officials, epidemiologists, and researchers.","Owner":"Research institutions and public health organizations."},{"Description":"Misunderstanding the distinction between droplet transmission and airborne transmission.","Impact":"Inadequate infection control measures and mismanagement of contagious disease spread.","Mitigation":"Provide clear definitions and guidelines on droplet and airborne transmission in indoor environments.","Technologies":"Air quality monitoring systems, airflow simulation software, and particle size measurement devices.","People":"Healthcare practitioners, facility managers, and policymakers.","Owner":"Public health authorities and regulatory bodies."},{"Description":"Inadequate investigation of droplets and aerosols produced by expiratory events such as coughing and sneezing.","Impact":"Limited understanding of virus spread and transmission in indoor environments.","Mitigation":"Conduct detailed studies on the dynamics of expiratory droplets and aerosols to inform infection control strategies.","Technologies":"High-speed cameras, particle dispersion visualization tools, and computational fluid dynamics simulations.","People":"Research scientists, medical professionals, and environmental engineers.","Owner":"Research institutions, healthcare organizations, and government agencies."}]}
